name: Infoblox NIOS
description: This integration enables Splunk SOAR to retrieve IP metadata from Infoblox Grid Manager and manage DNS Firewall protections through RPZs. It allows security teams to define RPZ rules that block DNS resolution for malicious or unauthorized domains, or redirect users to a walled garden by modifying DNS responses

actions.description: Validate credentials provided for connectivity
actions.verbose: Note: Even if the credentials are correct, if Infoblox is configured with an ACL that does not allow Splunk SOAR to authenticate to it, you will receive an authentication failure.

actions.description: Updates an existing rule in RPZ CNAME to modify DNS behavior
actions.verbose: Updates an existing rule in RPZ CNAME to modify DNS behavior.

reference_id.description: The reference ID of the existing RPZ rule to update

rule_type.description: The type of the rule to create

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

substitute_name.description: The substitute name to assign (required only when Rule Type is 'Substitute (domain name)')

view.description: The DNS view in which the records are located

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create rpz rule (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl)

actions.description: Adds a CNAME rule to an existing RPZ to override DNS behavior
actions.verbose: Adds a CNAME rule to an existing RPZ to override DNS behavior.

rule_type.description: The type of the rule to create

object_type.description: The type of the object for which to assign the rule

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

substitute_name.description: The substitute name to assign (required only when Rule Type is 'Substitute (domain name)')

view.description: The DNS view in which the records are located

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create rpz rule (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl)

actions.description: Adds an RPZ rule for A (IPv4) responses to block or redirect DNS queries
actions.verbose: Adds an RPZ rule for A (IPv4) responses to block or redirect DNS queries.

object_type.description: The type of the object for which to create record

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

ipv4_address.description: The IPv4 address of the substitute rule

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl, view)

actions.description: Returns IPAM info for a given IP

ip_address.description: The IP address for which to retrieve information, e.g. "192.168.1.1". Cannot be used in conjunction with network or from/to_ip arguments

network.description: The network that the IP belongs to is in FQDN/CIDR format, e.g. "192.168.1.0/24". Cannot be used in conjunction with ip or from/to_ip arguments

from_ip.description: The beginning of the IP range, e.g. "192.168.1.0". Must be used in conjunction with to_ip

to_ip.description: The end of the IP range, e.g. "192.168.1.254". Must be used in conjunction with from_ip

status.description: The status of the IP device. Used in conjunction with the network or ip argument. Possible values are ACTIVE, UNUSED and USED

extended_attributes.description: Comma-separated key/value formatted filter for extended attributes, e.g. "Site=New York,OtherProp=MyValue"

limit.description: Maximum numbers of objects to be returned

actions.description: Retrieves host records from Infoblox including hostname, associated IPv4/IPv6 addresses (A/AAAA records), PTR records, DNS view information, and any configured extensible attributes

limit.description: Maximum numbers of objects to be returned

extended_attributes.description: Comma-separated key/value formatted filter for extended attributes, e.g. "Site=New York,OtherProp=MyValue"

actions.description: Adds an SRV record override in RPZ for service-based DNS lookups

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

priority.description: The priority of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule

rp_zone.description: The name of a response policy zone in which the record resides

port.description: The port of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule

weight.description: The weight of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone

example_values: Successfully created SRV rule in RPZ zone rpz.security.local

actions.description: Adds a NAPTR override in RPZ to control DNS-based service discovery

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

order.description: Order parameter in NAPTR record defines the sequence of rule application when multiple rules exist

preference.description: The preference of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule record

replacement.description: The substitute rule object replacement field of the NAPTR record. For non-terminal NAPTR records, this field specifies the next domain name to look up

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone

example_values: Successfully created NAPTR rule in RPZ zone
Successfully created NAPTR rule in RPZ zone rpz.security.local

actions.description: Retrieves DHCP lease details for a MAC or IP address

hardware.description: MAC address for IPv4 leases. Regex or exact search supported

hostname.description: Hostname sent via DHCP option 12. Regex/exact search

ipv6_duid.description: IPv6 DUID identifier for IPv6 leases. Regex/exact search

protocol.description: One of: BOTH, IPV4, IPV6; exact match only

fingerprint.description: DHCP client fingerprint; caseâ€‘insensitive or regex search

username.description: User associated with lease request; case-insensitive/regex search

limit.description: Maximum numbers of objects to be returned

actions.description: Lists defined IPv4/IPv6 networks and subnets in IPAM

network.description: The network address in CIDR notation (e.g., "192.168.1.0/24")

limit.description: Maximum numbers of objects to be returned

extended_attributes.description: Comma-separated key/value formatted filter for extended attributes, e.g. "Site=New York,OtherProp=MyValue"

actions.description: Adds an RPZ rule for AAAA (IPv6) responses to block or redirect DNS queries
actions.verbose: Adds an RPZ rule for AAAA (IPv6) responses to block or redirect DNS queries.

object_type.description: The type of the object for which to create record

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

ipv6_address.description: The IPv6 address of the substitute rule

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl, view)

actions.description: Adds a mail exchange override rule to an RPZ
actions.verbose: Adds a mail exchange override rule to an RPZ.

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

mail_exchanger.description: The mail exchanger name in FQDN format

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl, view)

actions.description: Adds a reverse DNS lookup override in RPZ for an IP
actions.verbose: Adds a reverse DNS lookup override in RPZ for an IP.

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

ptr_dname.description: The domain name of the RPZ substitute rule object of the PTR record

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

ipv4_address.description: The IPv4 address of the substitute rule

ipv6_address.description: The IPv6 address of the substitute rule

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl, view)

actions.description: Adds a TXT record rule in RPZ to associate text data with a DNS response
actions.verbose: Adds a TXT record rule in RPZ to associate text data with a DNS response.

rp_zone.description: The zone to assign the rule to

name.description: Specify the name of the rule

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone (disable, extattrs, ttl, use_ttl, view)

actions.description: Create a host record in Infoblox NIOS
actions.verbose: This action creates a host record in Infoblox NIOS with the specified name and IP addresses. You can provide IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses, along with optional parameters such as view, comment, and extended attributes.

ipv4_addresses.description: JSON array of IPv4 address objects. Each object must contain 'ipv4addr' and can optionally include 'mac', 'configure_for_dhcp', etc. Example: [{"ipv4addr":"192.168.1.10","mac":"00:11:22:33:44:55"}]

ipv6_addresses.description: JSON array of IPv6 address objects. Each object must contain 'ipv6addr' and can optionally include 'duid', 'configure_for_dhcp', etc. Example: [{"ipv6addr":"2001:db8::1"}]

view.description: The DNS view in which to create the host record

configure_for_dns.description: Configure the host record for DNS

aliases.description: Comma-separated list of aliases for the host record

extended_attributes.description: Extended attributes in key=value format, separated by commas. Example: Site=Boston,Department=IT

example_values: Successfully created host record with reference ID: record:host/ZG5zLmhvc3QkLl9kZWZhdWx0LmNvbS5leGFtcGxlLmhvc3Qx:host1.example.com/default

actions.description: Delete a Response Policy Zone (RPZ) rule
actions.verbose: This action deletes an RPZ rule using its reference ID. The reference ID should be in the format provided by the Infoblox NIOS API.

ref.description: Reference ID of the RPZ rule to delete

actions.description: Removes an existing Response Policy Zone from Infoblox

reference_id.description: The reference ID of the response policy zone

actions.description: Creates a new Response Policy Zone (RPZ) to define custom DNS responses

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone in FQDN format

substitute_name.description: The alternative name of the redirect target is a substitute response policy zone

rpz_policy.description: The override policy of the response policy zone

rpz_severity.description: The severity of the response policy zone

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to create response policy zone

actions.description: Retrieves Response Policy Zone(s) based on specified criteria

fqdn.description: The fully qualified domain name of the response policy zone to retrieve

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Search for RPZ rules in Infoblox NIOS
actions.verbose: This action allows you to search for Response Policy Zone (RPZ) rules in Infoblox NIOS. You can filter by name, view, zone, canonical, or comment.

rule_name.description: The full rule name (usually the rule name followed by its zone.(e.g. name.domain.com)

output_fields.description: The comma-separated fields to include in the returned object (e.g., address, comment, etc.)

limit.description: Maximum number of objects to be returned
